list_definition.definition: the state of being a brother
an association of men for a certain purpose

list_ex_of_english: She is thereby a sign of that brotherhood which permits and encourages a sincere dialogue.
Many of the railway workers were organized into the railway brotherhoods, which were craft unions.
Traditional requirements of brotherhoods to prove the ' purity ' of their bloodline were abolished and the dues of the judges were reduced.
Both programs failed, and the brotherhoods were largely stagnant in the 1920s.
Sufi brotherhoods have retreated considerably, but remain in some areas.
The main participants of the procession are the members of various religious brotherhoods, who carry and accompany large platforms with religious images through the streets.
Not a single one of the etymologies suggested by members of this brotherhood seems to have a chance of being correct.
Again, by joining these brotherhoods, approaching outsiders conveyed their credibility to existing members, making possible exchange.
